g.H622: to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
g.H5921: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
g.H5221: to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
g.H1004: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

g.H6213: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
g.H853: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
g.H269: a sister (used very widely (like brother), literally and figuratively)
g.H2181: to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatr...
